page.title: 04THE MUSLIM CHILD IN PRESTON
page.content: I am Tahera Patel. Tahera means clean. I was born in England but my parents were born in India. My father was born in Kantharia and my mother in Nandewar. These are two small villages near Baruch. I go to Deepdale Junior School to learn English but at home I speak Gujarati. After school I go to Qu-watul-Islam mosque. I wear a burkha in the mosque. This is a white cloth which covers me from head to foot with only my face showing. We have to pray at home after the mosque. June this year is the holy month of Ramadam and we are now fasting. After Ramadam it is our Eid festival. We are all looking forward to Eid.
